pros: Great place to work at
cons: None off the top of my head

pros: The people I work with at CRHS are like a second family. We compliment each other’s strengths and weaknesses. For a small community hospital, we have a wide range of experience in our employees.
cons: High turnover. May be due to staff looking for more opportunities offered in larger hospitals.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Columbus, GA
pros: None none none none none.
cons: Toxic environment. Underpaid. Toxic Environment.

pros: Great learning experience and great staff
cons: Not enough support from managers

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Whiteville, NC
pros: Competitive benefits, fair pay, family atmosphere
cons: Can't think of any cons.

pros: You have an opportunity to learn and experience areas of nursing you will be interested in and get exposed to procedures you will have to administer as a nursing student and future nurse. When they love you, the word gets around. It is also a great feeling when you can make even the smallest difference in a patient or family member's life with the little things we all can do.
cons: You will find areas of nursing you will not be greatly excited about. The hours you have to work will greatly impact your school work, study time and any possible rest. You may have to resign before your time is up, if you can not keep up in school. When you graduate and you don't accept a job because the area of interest are not available, they don't want to see you anymore. They will get the word out not to let you work on any floor even if you have a family.

pros:
Decent Benefits
Payroll deduction for food at hospital
cons: Too many employees have been working there 30 years or more

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Columbus, GA
pros: Staff very friendly and eager to learn. Physicians open to suggestions and willing to answer questions in detail. Uniform shop onsite. Good cafeteria with many options.
cons: Management style not conducive to employee growth. Focus too much on minor details that creates atmosphere of intimidation. Rather than hiring those with great expertise, they prefer staff with less knowledge than themselves. Not open to suggestions, making employees feel boxed in. Also workloads unmanageable for inexperienced therapists and quite frankly dangerous to patients.

pros: Always busy, the time flew by.
cons: The supervisor was not truthful in the description of job training/duties.  My training consisted of me getting a cart and going to the floor.Hardly explained anything to me.  Too much drama among co-workers. NEVER enough staff. Night shift people would call off, morning shift people would call off, which made morning rounds horrific. 3 people quit in a week while I was there. It just seemed very unorganized and depressing. They had a phlebotomist there who came down from the floor with 16 "hard sticks"!! But they let her continue to work there. The lab was a joke.

review_title: Before CRHS purchased other facilities, work was absolutely fabulous.
pros: I loved the fast pace in my job.  I was able to learn how to multi-task and get organized quickly.  Fellow employees were absolutely great to work with and for.  I learned a great deal and was able to be back-up person for many jobs thus broadening my skills to various other jobs.  However, Mid and Senior Management were not always fair or honest.
cons: Mid Management needs some people skills on how to treat employees under them.  Everyone in the hospital seemed to know all the details on everyone's private and professional lives.

review_title: Possibly a good company to work for, but certain departments desperately need new management.
pros: It does seem as if the company is making attempts to improve, and I hope for their sake it happens before they lose good, quality employees.
cons: Very unfair and unjust termination of good quality, hard working, highly qualified employees by some managers for purely personal reasons.

review_title: Surgeon at CRHS for 8 years seeing progressive decline in care to patients.
pros: The hospital does provide care to all comers.
cons:
Management is not physician friendly and has slowly alienated the nursing staff with
poor wages and demands for work not crucial to patient care.

pros: The staff is friendly, and works hard to help make this establishment what it is.
cons:
Uncompetitive salary
Poor staffing patterns
Poor balance between work and personal life

pros: There are many opportunities within company, competitive pay, great managers. There are many reasons that I decided to stay so long.
cons: If you get an advanced degree, there are less opportunities available in higher positions. This is the only reason that I left. There were no nurse practitioner positions available.

pros: Great people and agressive growth plans.
cons: Bottom up restructuring and frequent, disruptive changes.  Attempts to recoup financial losses of years past resulting in insufficient staff to operate many departments successfully.

job_title: Account Executive in New York, NY
pros: Teamwork everybody help each other no matter we are from different team, no matter I was new to ask some entry questions
cons: Not easy to commute. I lived too far and had contract with leasing and can't move on time

review_title: An organization more interested in taking over health care in the area than taking care of sick people.
pros: good salaries, room for advancement
cons: poor patient care, poor customer service, staff lacks knowledge, hands of supervision

pros: Love the floor I work on and the people I work with. Most nurses are helpful. They provide benefits such as health, dental, eye care.
cons: When census is low they float to other floors and it can be stressful. Some times the job can be very demanding.

pros: Good Benefits, Culture, Mission, Customers, and Charities
cons: Sometimes you won't be allowed to leave your department. You won't necessarily get a promotion you deserve because they already have someone in mind.

review_title: Treading water in a changing environment
pros: local employer, fair benefits, great employee base
cons: Poor and disjointed physician leadership.  Personal agendas. Executive ego's and executive turnover. Duplication of services.

pros: Great working environment. Awesome coworkers. Overtime available if you want it.
cons: Work load can be a little much. Pay needs to increase.

job_title: Physician Practice Manager in Columbus, GA
pros: High Energy workplace; Relevant and to date; Family Atmosphere
cons: I am currently trying to come back to work there and would love to have an opportunity.

pros: A very positive, customer-centric organization.
cons: Recognize experience from your lower echelon workers when making corporate decisions.

pros: I love working with great Physicians and NP. I enjoy taking care of my patients and helping them when they ask.
cons: Lack of communication in the office.

pros: Good benefits, chance for advancement
cons: Dehumanize, some areas advancement is based on who you know

pros: Great company to work for overall.  Lower management is great.
cons: Upper and executive management seems disconnected with work environment at times.

pros: Very good environment plus salary.
cons: Long hours and not enough help.

job_title: Patient Account Manager in Greenfield, WI
pros: The patients were the best part and the bonds that were formed.
cons: I cannot think of any cons

pros: Enjoyed the ability to move up the "ladder". Good benefits package.
cons: Short staffed on a regular basis.

pros: Small hospital with great pay.
cons: not enough help on night shift

pros: TO TAKE CARE OF MY FAMILY
